channel.title: BBC Sport
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Salah returns as Liverpool score three to beat Marseille
item.description: Mohammad Salah returns to the Liverpool starting XI as Liverpool score three goals, including an intelligent Dominik Szoboszlai free kick, to beat Olympique Marseille.

item.title: Newcastle secure last-16 play-off spot after comfortable win over PSV
item.description: Newcastle United clinch a Champions League last 16 play-off spot following a comfortable 3-0 win over PSV Eindhoven at St James's Park.

item.title: Chelsea keep top-eight hopes alive with win over Pafos
item.description: Moises Caicedo's 77th-minute goal keeps Chelsea's hopes of finishing in the Champions League top eight alive after victory of Pafos at Stamford Bridge.

item.title: Defeat for 10-player Arsenal as Man Utd reach first League Cup final
item.description: Manchester United reach the Women's League Cup final for the first time with a narrow 1-0 victory against Arsenal, in a rain-drenched semi-final at Meadow Park.

item.title: Kaptein goal sends Chelsea into seventh straight League Cup final
item.description: Holders Chelsea reach a seventh successive final of the Women's League Cup with a narrow victory over rivals Manchester City at Joie Stadium.

item.title: Kane brace sees Bayern Munich triumph over Union SG
item.description: Harry Kane scores twice and misses a penalty as 10-man Bayern Munich secure their place in the last 16 of the Champions League with a comfortable victory over Union Saint-Gilloise.

item.title: Lopez stunner sees Barcelona beat Prague in six-goal thriller
item.description: Fermin Lopez scores a brace, including a stunning curling effort as Barcelona beat Slavia Prague in a six-goal thriller, keeping the Spanish league leaders one place outside the top eight of the Champions League.

item.title: Qarabag score last-gasp winner to seal comeback win over Frankfurt
item.description: Qarabag score a dramatic stoppage-time winner to end Eintracht Frankfurt's hopes of reaching the Champions League play-offs and keep their own alive.

item.title: Llorente own goal earns Galatasaray draw with Atletico
item.description: An own goal from Atletico Madrid's Marcus Llorente earns Galatasaray a draw after Giuliano Simeone gave the visitors an early lead, as both sides fail to find the net in the second half.

item.title: Wissa scores first Newcastle Champions League goal
item.description: Yoane Wissa capitalises on a PSV mistake to score his first Champions League goal for Newcastle United.

item.title: Spurs beat 10-man Dortmund to ease pressure on Frank
item.description: Goals from Cristian Romero and Dominic Solanke help Tottenham Hotspur to a comfortable win against Borussia Dortmund, giving manager Thomas Frank a much needed boost.

item.title: Bodo/Glimt humble Man City with stunning home win
item.description: Kasper Hogh scores twice as Norwegian debutants Bodo/Glimt claim one of the biggest upsets in Champions League history by beating Manchester City 3-1.

item.title: Palace striker Mateta tells club he wants to leave
item.description: France striker Jean-Philippe Mateta has 18 months remaining on his current deal at Selhurst Park and as things stand he will not be signing an extension.

item.title: Spurs, Arsenal or Newcastle - which teams have had most injuries?
item.description: BBC Sport crunches the numbers to assess which Premier League teams have been hit hardest by injuries this season.

item.title: Women's Club World Cup schedule could be 'catastrophic' for WSL
item.description: English players and officials are shocked by the current scheduling for the inaugural Women's Club World Cup because of the impact it could have on the WSL.

item.title: Bove returns with Watford after cardiac arrest
item.description: Watford sign former Roma and Fiorentina midfielder Edoardo Bove on a five-and-a-half-year deal.

item.title: Arsenal extend perfect Champions League record with victory in Milan
item.description: Gabriel Jesus scores twice as Arsenal win at Inter Milan to maintain their 100% record in the Champions League.

item.title: Suarez strikes late to give Lisbon win over PSG
item.description: Sporting Lisbon stun current Champions League holders Paris Saint-Germain with a 2-1 victory. Striker Luis Suarez netted a brace including a 90th-minute winner.

item.title: Mbappe scores twice as Real thrash Monaco
item.description: Kylian Mbappe scores twice with Jude Bellingham also on target as Real Madrid thrash Monaco in Alvaro Arbeloa's first Champions League game in charge of the Spanish side.

item.title: Athletic Club edge past Atalanta in five-goal thriller
item.description: Athletic Club produce a stirring second-half fightback to dent Atalanta's hopes of automatically reaching the last 16 of the Champions League, while boosting their own play-off ambitions.

item.title: Napoli held to draw by 10-man Copenhagen
item.description: Napoli's hopes of reaching the knockout stages of the Champions League are dealt a blow as they are held to a 1-1 draw by 10-man Copenhagen.

item.title: Late winner keeps Ajax qualification dreams alive
item.description: Oliver Edvardsen scores a late winner as Ajax come from behind to beat Villarreal and keep alive their hopes of reaching the Champions League play-offs.

item.title: Olympiacos see off Leverkusen to boost Champions League hopes
item.description: Olympiacos keep alive their hopes of advancing in the Champions League as first-half goals from Costinha and Mehdi Taremi see off Bayer Leverkusen.

item.title: Club Brugge keep alive play-off hopes after win over Kairat
item.description: Club Brugge keep alive their Champions League play-offs hopes with a comfortable win at Kairat Almaty.

item.title: 'Everything is going wrong' - Guardiola on Bodo/Glimt upset
item.description: Pep Guardiola responds to his team's second defeat in four days as Manchester City lose at Bodo/Glimt in the Champions League.

item.title: Watch: Livingston 1-1 St Mirren highlights
item.description: Watch highlights as St Mirren's Alex Gogic scores a late equaliser to deny Livingston their first victory in the Scottish Premiership since early August.

item.title: What we learned from Afcon 2025
item.description: After chaotic scenes in the Africa Cup of Nations final, BBC Sport Africa explores what else we learned from just under a month of competition in Morocco.

item.title: Aston Villa target Loftus-Cheek - Thursday's gossip
item.description: Ruben Loftus-Cheek emerges as Aston Villa and Man Utd target, Spurs weigh up Crysencio Summerville move, Liverpool interested in Micky van de Ven and Forest eye Kostas Tsimikas.

item.title: Man City squad to refund ticket costs for fans
item.description: Manchester City's squad will refund the ticket costs for 374 supporters who travelled to Norway to witness their side's shock 3-1 Champions League defeat at Bodo/Glimt on Tuesday.

item.title: 'No desire' for World Cup boycott over Greenland
item.description: The French government is not currently in favour of boycotting this summer's World Cup over US President Donald Trump's threats to annex Greenland, according to the country's sports minister.

item.title: Villa's injury woes worsen as McGinn set for spell out
item.description: Injury-hit Aston Villa suffer another blow, with captain John McGinn facing a number of weeks on the sidelines.

item.title: Marseille agree loan deal for Arsenal's Nwaneri
item.description: French club Marseille agree to sign Arsenal midfielder Ethan Nwaneri on loan for the rest of the season.

item.title: Why do Chelsea want another centre-back?
item.description: The Blues already have eight central defenders on their books, so why are they still looking to bring another centre-back to the club?

item.title: Bournemouth close on £30.6m move for Brazilian striker Rayan
item.description: The 19-year-old is in advanced talks about moving to the south coast and will help the Cherries replace Antoine Semenyo, who joined Manchester City last week.

item.title: Bellingham responds to partying claims with 'joke' drinking celebration
item.description: Jude Bellingham responds to partying claims with a goal celebration in the Champions League win over Monaco.

item.title: 'Good signs' or just buying time? Spurs remain divided on Frank future
item.description: Many Tottenham fans have already lost faith in Thomas Frank - but did Tuesday's 2-0 win over Borussia Dortmund give cause for optimism?

item.title: Champions League quiz: Name every city to host a final
item.description: The Champions League and its forerunner the European Cup have a combined 70-year history. Can you name all the cities that have staged the final of the men's competition?

item.title: US opens priority visa appointment system for World Cup
item.description: World Cup 2026 ticket holders can now access priority visa appointments for travel to the United States - but doubt remains whether fans from every country to have qualified will be able to enter.

item.title: 'Battered in Bodo' - is this more than just a blip for Man City?
item.description: Manchester City suffered their very own "hell of a beating" moment in Norway on Tuesday - now Pep Guardiola and his players must turn around their fortunes in an increasingly trying January.

item.title: Rangers' opponents Stranraer face cup expulsion
item.description: Stranraer face losing out on £200,000 which could "keep the club running for three or four years" if they are expelled from the Scottish Cup and miss out on a visit to Rangers for fielding an ineligible player.

item.title: Hearts working on signings after Mendy bid rejected
item.description: Hearts have a bid for Forest Green Rovers midfielder Laurent Mendy turned down by the National League club.

item.title: Canadian league set to trial Wenger's offside idea
item.description: The Canadian Premier League is given permission to trial Arsene Wenger's "daylight" offside rule.

item.title: The day I discovered the Everton contract Revie never signed
item.description: This is the story of how an unsigned contract that lay hidden in a bungalow for more than 50 years could have changed the course of English football.

item.title: Is a Panenka ever the right choice for a penalty?
item.description: Following Morocco's last-minute spot-kick miss in the Africa Cup of Nations final, BBC Sport asks if a Panenka is ever the right choice for a penalty.

item.title: Man City sign Guehi from Palace - what will he bring?
item.description: Man City sign Crystal Palace captain Marc Guehi for £20m - but what will the England defender add to Pep Guardiola's side?

item.title: 'Shameful' and 'terrible look' - the chaos that marred Senegal's Afcon triumph
item.description: Senegal beat Morocco to win the Africa Cup of Nations after the final is overshadowed when they temporarily refuse to play.

item.title: 'Arsenal will never forgive themselves if they don't win title now'
item.description: This is Mikel Arteta and Arsenal's "now or never" moment as Premier League title rivals stumble badly, says chief football writer Phil McNulty.

item.title: 'Results, results' - how Guardiola outlasted five Man Utd bosses
item.description: Pep Guardiola takes on a sixth different Manchester United boss in Saturday's derby as he approaches a decade at City, but how has he outlasted all of those before Michael Carrick?

item.title: Transfers - January 2026
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: Can January signings play in the Champions League?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why Antoine Semenyo and Conor Gallagher won't yet be able to play for their new clubs in the Champions League.

item.title: How much has Guardiola spent on defenders at Man City?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at how many defenders Manchester City have signed since Pep Guardiola arrived at the Etihad.

item.title: What is it like to be a caretaker manager?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains what life is like as a caretaker boss after Michael Carrick's appointment at Manchester United, with Neil Warnock and Phil Brown detailing their experiences.

item.title: Who is Manchester City debutant Max Alleyne?
item.description: Manchester City defender Max Alleyne will make his Premier League debut on Wednesday after being named in Pep Guardiola's team to face Brighton.

item.title: Why is there no VAR in the FA Cup third and fourth round?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain why VAR is not in use in the third and fourth rounds of the FA Cup.

item.title: What is the Women's Champions Cup and who will Arsenal play?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at Fifa's new Women's Champions Cup.

item.title: Is the new manager bounce real or a myth?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains whether the new manager bounce is real, or just a myth

item.title: Sparta star to Gladbach outcast - what will Celtic get with Cvancara?
item.description: Manager Martin O'Neill has confirmed that Tomas Cvancara is on his way to Celtic, so what can fans expect from the Czech Republic striker?

item.title: Bologna's Ferguson seeks first win over Celtic
item.description: Bologna captain Lewis Ferguson is targeting a first win over Celtic in 17 attempts when the Italians host the Scottish champions on Europa League duty.

item.title: BBC to show St Mirren & Falkirk Scottish Cup ties
item.description: BBC Scotland will broadcast live television coverage of Airdrieonians v St Mirren and Stenhousemuir v Falkirk in the Scottish Cup.

item.title: Bayern's record-breaking Bundesliga season in numbers
item.description: BBC Sport examines the stunning numbers behind Bayern Munich's record-breaking start to the Bundesliga season - and what records they could topple.

item.title: Tottenham sign Gallagher from Atletico for £35m
item.description: The former Chelsea midfielder joins Spurs on a deal until 2031.

item.title: Why Alonso's reign is over at Real Madrid
item.description: After Xabi Alonso's departure as Real Madrid manager, Spanish football expert Guillem Balague looks into where it all went wrong.

item.title: Hasty or a shrewd move? Madrid in shock at swift Arbeloa appointment
item.description: Many Real Madrid fans are in shock at Alvaro Arbeloa's appointment as manager - is it a hasty move or a shrewd decision?

item.title: Liverpool midfielder Hobinger was sent underwear pictures by stalker
item.description: Father-of-two Mangal Dalal, 42, is given a restraining order for stalking the Reds midfielder.

item.title: City Ground to host England-Iceland qualifier
item.description: England will host Iceland in a Women's World Cup qualifier on 7 March at Nottingham Forest's City Ground.

item.title: Chelsea host Manchester United in Women's FA Cup
item.description: Holders Chelsea will take on Manchester United in the fifth round of the Women's FA Cup - a repeat of last year's final.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: Captain, player, manager, Mister, number one - Davids at Barnet
item.description: BBC Sport remembers Edgar Davids' 15 months as Barnet player-manager in League Two and the Conference.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.
